paragraphs.content: The Proverbs
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Proverbs

paragraphs.content: Chapter 1
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 1

paragraphs.content: The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel;
paragraphs.contentHtml: The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel;

paragraphs.content: To know wisdom and instruction; to perceive the words of understanding;
paragraphs.contentHtml: To know wisdom and instruction; to perceive the words of understanding;

paragraphs.content: To receive the instruction of wisdom, justice, and judgment, and equity;
paragraphs.contentHtml: To receive the instruction of wisdom, justice, and judgment, and equity;

paragraphs.content: To give subtilty to the simple, to the young man knowledge and discretion.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To give subtilty to the simple, to the young man knowledge and discretion.

paragraphs.content: A wise man will hear, and will increase learning; and a man of understanding shall attain unto wise counsels:
paragraphs.contentHtml: A wise man will hear, and will increase learning; and a man of understanding shall attain unto wise counsels:

paragraphs.content: To understand a proverb, and the interpretation; the words of the wise, and their dark sayings.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To understand a proverb, and the interpretation; the words of the wise, and their dark sayings.

paragraphs.content: ¶ The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.

paragraphs.content: My son, hear the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother:
paragraphs.contentHtml: My son, hear the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother:

paragraphs.content: For they shall be an ornament of grace unto thy head, and chains about thy neck.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For they shall be an ornament of grace unto thy head, and chains about thy neck.

paragraphs.content: ¶ My son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ My son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not.

paragraphs.content: If they say, Come with us, let us lay wait for blood, let us lurk privily for the innocent without cause:
paragraphs.contentHtml: If they say, Come with us, let us lay wait for blood, let us lurk privily for the innocent without cause:

paragraphs.content: Let us swallow them up alive as the grave; and whole, as those that go down into the pit:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let us swallow them up alive as the grave; and whole, as those that go down into the pit:

paragraphs.content: We shall find all precious substance, we shall fill our houses with spoil:
paragraphs.contentHtml: We shall find all precious substance, we shall fill our houses with spoil:

paragraphs.content: Cast in thy lot among us; let us all have one purse:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Cast in thy lot among us; let us all have one purse:

paragraphs.content: My son, walk not thou in the way with them; refrain thy foot from their path:
paragraphs.contentHtml: My son, walk not thou in the way with them; refrain thy foot from their path:

paragraphs.content: For their feet run to evil, and make haste to shed blood.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For their feet run to evil, and make haste to shed blood.

paragraphs.content: Surely in vain the net is spread in the sight of any bird.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Surely in vain the net is spread in the sight of any bird.

paragraphs.content: And they lay wait for their own blood; they lurk privily for their own lives.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And they lay wait for their own blood; they lurk privily for their own lives.

paragraphs.content: So are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain; which taketh away the life of the owners thereof.
paragraphs.contentHtml: So are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain; which taketh away the life of the owners thereof.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Wisdom crieth without; she uttereth her voice in the streets:
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Wisdom crieth without; she uttereth her voice in the streets:

paragraphs.content: She crieth in the chief place of concourse, in the openings of the gates: in the city she uttereth her words, saying,
paragraphs.contentHtml: She crieth in the chief place of concourse, in the openings of the gates: in the city she uttereth her words, saying,

paragraphs.content: How long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity? and the scorners delight in their scorning, and fools hate knowledge?
paragraphs.contentHtml: How long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity? and the scorners delight in their scorning, and fools hate knowledge?

paragraphs.content: Turn you at my reproof: behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you, I will make known my words unto you.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Turn you at my reproof: behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you, I will make known my words unto you.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Because I have called, and ye refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no man regarded;
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Because I have called, and ye refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no man regarded;

paragraphs.content: But ye have set at nought all my counsel, and would none of my reproof:
paragraphs.contentHtml: But ye have set at nought all my counsel, and would none of my reproof:

paragraphs.content: I also will laugh at your calamity; I will mock when your fear cometh;
paragraphs.contentHtml: I also will laugh at your calamity; I will mock when your fear cometh;

paragraphs.content: When your fear cometh as desolation, and your destruction cometh as a whirlwind; when distress and anguish cometh upon you.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When your fear cometh as desolation, and your destruction cometh as a whirlwind; when distress and anguish cometh upon you.

paragraphs.content: Then shall they call upon me, but I will not answer; they shall seek me early, but they shall not find me:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then shall they call upon me, but I will not answer; they shall seek me early, but they shall not find me:

paragraphs.content: For that they hated knowledge, and did not choose the fear of the LORD:
paragraphs.contentHtml: For that they hated knowledge, and did not choose the fear of the Lord:

paragraphs.content: They would none of my counsel: they despised all my reproof.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They would none of my counsel: they despised all my reproof.

paragraphs.content: Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own devices.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own devices.

paragraphs.content: For the turning away of the simple shall slay them, and the prosperity of fools shall destroy them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the turning away of the simple shall slay them, and the prosperity of fools shall destroy them.

paragraphs.content: But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be quiet from fear of evil.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be quiet from fear of evil.
